Lawrence Livermore Nat'l Lab RED Group
Information: Developed new techniques for analysis of low-energy ionization backgrounds in LZ. Characterized low-energy ionization backgrounds in a dual-phase xenon time projection chamber (TPC) with exotic low-outgassing materials. Designed and built a gas sampling system for a novel xenon-doped argon test stand.
Designed and investigated sample heating and cooling solutions to improve quality of superconducting qubit samples.

Item: SLAC Nat'l Accelerator Laboratory Noble Liquids Group
Information: Directed and performed retrofits of LZ System Test thermosyphons. Designed cleanroom for LZ grid tests. Built out hundred-liter scale automated liquid nitrogen delivery systems. Assisted with xenon sampling and purification efforts.
Simulated electric fields for a prototype liquid xenon purity monitor.

Item: Lawrence Berkeley Nat'l Lab Sorensen Group
Information: Simulated electric fields in a novel TPC with charge readout capabilities. Tested and installed charge-shaping amplifiers. Assisted in testing a novel high voltage feedthrough design.
Assisted in design and assembly of an experiment using quartz crystal oscillators to test for violations of Lorentz symmetry.

Item: UMD Undergraduate Physics for Biologists I \& II
Information: Led laboratory sections and developed course materials for instructing students on data acquisition, handling and processing techniques.
Co-led seminar for undergraduates on cutting-edge physics research at UC Berkeley and arranged for weekly speakers.
